newsitem.title: ITALY: Specialists show strong interest in Italy 2-yr CTZ.
newsitem.headline: Specialists show strong interest in Italy 2-yr CTZ.

text.p: Specialist bond traders bid for and were allocated 35 billion lire of 18-month Italian Treasury zero coupon certificates (CTZ) against an offer of 150 billion lire worth, while they got an offered 200 billion lire worth of two-year CTZs after bidding for 396 billion lire worth.
Earlier, the Treasury received bids for 3.926 trillion lire at the open auction for the October 15, 1998 paper against 1.5 trillion lire worth of certificates on offer.
The auction price was set at 91.95 from 91.80 at the previous sale on May 27 with a gross yield of 6.51 vs 6.41.
For the May 14, 1999 CTZs, bids totalled 4.442 trillion lire against an offer of 2.0 trillion lire worth. The assigned price was 88.70 against 88.55 and gross yield 6.48 against 6.41 percent.
